macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Jones Hits Record High at 49,462 as US Markets Climb
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose about 1% to a fresh record of 49,462, while the S&P 500 gained 0.6% and Nasdaq Composite 0.7%, driven by tech shares and optimism on economic data. Early Wednesday trading saw S&P 500 and Dow set new intraday highs minutes after open.

items.title: Asian Markets Mixed with Declines in Japan, Korea, China and Hong Kong
items.summary: Nikkei 225 fell 0.9% to 52,041.97, Kospi dropped 0.5% to 4,503.23, Hang Seng lost 1% to 26,471.97, while Shanghai Composite rose 0.3% to 4,095.94 and S&P/ASX 200 gained 0.3%. Moves reflect caution amid global rate expectations and geopolitical risks.

items.title: US Markets Await Key Economic Data: ADP Employment, ISM Services PMI, JOLTs
items.summary: Investors cautious ahead of ADP Employment Change, ISM Services PMI, and JOLTs Job Openings releases. US index futures largely flat, with Russell 2000 up 0.15% above 2,600 and Nasdaq 100 down 0.2%.

items.title: Q4 Earnings Season Kicks Off with Constellation, Jefferies, Albertsons Reports
items.summary: Earnings season begins today with reports from Constellation, Jefferies, and Albertsons. Markets show gains in healthcare, real estate, cyclicals, communication services, and industrials early Wednesday.

items.title: Brent Crude Eases on US Plans for Venezuelan Oil After Maduro Ousting
items.summary: Brent crude declined as US expects to control 30-50 million barrels of sanctioned Venezuelan crude for market sale following Nicolás Maduro's ousting. WTI Crude down 0.81% to $56.66, natural gas up 2.69%.

items.title: Eurozone Inflation Slightly Below Estimates, EURUSD Rebounds
items.summary: Eurozone inflation came in slightly below estimates, pushing EURUSD up 0.05% to around 1.169 after prior drop. Dollar index slipped 0.07% below 30-day EMA amid subdued FX volatility.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Drops 1.52% to $3.15T Amid Mixed Trading
items.summary: Major cryptocurrencies traded mixed with Bitcoin down 1.59% to $91,987 after failing to break $94,500, while outperformers like BREV surged 604%. Ethereum held steady at $3,229 (+0.13%), but XRP fell 3.65% to $2.2573.

items.title: Bitcoin Selloff Accelerates to $91,000 on Asia-Led Pressure
items.summary: Bitcoin slid 3% over 24 hours to just above $91,000 after stalling below $94,500 during Asian trading, dragging altcoins and the CoinDesk 20 Index down nearly 4%. The rally halted mid-week amid broader market weakness.

items.title: Stanford Professor's Babylon Raises $15M for Bitcoin Collateral Protocol
items.summary: Babylon, a decentralized protocol enabling Bitcoin collateralization without third-party custody, secured $15 million from a16z crypto. Founded by Stanford's David Tse, it aims to integrate with Aave in Q2 2026, competing with Coinbase and Tether.

items.title: U.S. Senate Banking Committee Advances Cryptocurrency Regulation Bill
items.summary: The Senate Banking Committee moved forward a key cryptocurrency regulation bill, marking a significant step in U.S. legislative efforts. This development highlights ongoing regulatory momentum amid market volatility.

items.title: Solana's Perpetual DEX Trading Volume Hits Record High in 2025
items.summary: Solana achieved a record high in perpetual DEX trading volume for 2025, underscoring strong ecosystem growth despite a slight 0.09% price dip to $138.01. Perpetual contract funding rates showed minor improvement.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Caterpillar Partners with NVIDIA for Physical AI and Robotics in Heavy Industry
items.summary: Caterpillar announced a collaboration with NVIDIA at CES 2026 to integrate NVIDIA Jetson Thor for AI inference on construction and mining equipment, debuting the Cat AI Assistant for real-time insights and enabling autonomy features.[3][5]

items.title: AAEON Unveils BOXER-8742AI Edge AI System on NVIDIA Jetson T4000
items.summary: At CES 2026, AAEON introduced the BOXER-8742AI, leveraging NVIDIA Blackwell architecture for 4x higher AI compute in fanless embedded systems ideal for smart factories, AMRs, and roadside units, with availability in Q2 2026.[4]

items.title: ASUS Launches AI-Powered Copilot+ PCs Lineup at CES 2026
items.summary: ASUS revealed new ProArt, Zenbook, Vivobook laptops, desktops, and the first Snapdragon-powered AiO PC with Copilot+ features, AMD Ryzen AI Max+ processors supporting 120B-parameter LLMs locally.[6]

items.title: Northeastern Researchers Develop RHYTHM AI for Predicting Human Movement
items.summary: Northeastern University introduced RHYTHM, an LLM-based model using mobility data that outperforms competitors by 2.4-5% in accuracy, especially during irregular periods, with applications in disaster response.[2]

items.title: Agentic AI Predicted to Reach Consumer-Scale Adoption in 2026
items.summary: A global survey indicates agentic AI will move from enterprise pilots to mass-market consumer adoption as early as 2026.[7]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Tatum Games and Glitch Announce Partnership to Boost Indie Game Discovery
items.summary: Tatum Games and Glitch have partnered to redefine indie game growth by combining data analytics, marketing, and community-driven discovery. The collaboration provides developers with smarter exposure pathways and aligns games with engaged players.[4]

items.title: ustwo Games Shifts to 'PC-First' Studio After Monument Valley 3 Leaves Netflix
items.summary: Monument Valley developer ustwo games is pivoting to a PC-first strategy following the unexpected removal of Monument Valley 3 from Netflix. The move seeks independence from platform strategy shifts by Netflix and Apple.[6]

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils G-Sync Pulsar and Gaming Tech Upgrades at CES 2026
items.summary: At CES 2026 Day 1, NVIDIA announced G-Sync Pulsar to reduce motion blur for esports and gaming, plus 2nd Gen Super Resolution Transformer now available and Dynamic 6x Frame Generation coming in spring. Lenovo showcased gaming laptops and Razer revealed Project Madison immersion chair concept.[2]

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct Teased with Potential Fable, Forza, Gears, Halo Reveals
items.summary: Reporter Jez Corden teases Xbox Developer Direct showcase featuring the 'four pillar franchises'—Fable, Forza Horizon 6, Gears of War: E-Day, Halo Campaign Evolved—plus a potential surprise. Playground Games confirmed to appear, setting tone for Xbox's 2026 lineup.[1]

items.title: Industry Outlook: Video Game 'Winter' Declared Over, Four Key Market Shifts for 2026
items.summary: Games industry veteran Zoran Roso states the 'video game winter' is ending, highlighting four market shifts to watch in 2026 amid recovery and growth.[5]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils G-Sync Pulsar and DLSS 4.5 at CES 2026
items.summary: NVIDIA announced G-Sync Pulsar, an advanced VRR technology for monitors, with first models from Acer, AOC, ASUS, and MSI launching January 7 featuring 27-inch 1440p IPS panels at 360Hz. DLSS 4.5 introduces improved Super Resolution and Dynamic Multi Frame Generation for enhanced gaming performance.

items.title: Qualcomm Reveals Snapdragon X2 Elite and X2 Plus Chips at CES
items.summary: Qualcomm showcased the Snapdragon X2 Elite high-performance laptop chip and more affordable Snapdragon X2 Plus, promising better battery life and performance, with upcoming laptops from Lenovo, Asus, and Dell.

items.title: Intel Launches Core Ultra Series 3 Processors with Enhanced Efficiency
items.summary: Intel introduced Core Ultra Series 3 chips offering up to 15% better performance per watt and 30% higher chip density, emphasizing U.S. manufacturing investments and Intel 18A process.

items.title: Samsung Showcases Creaseless Foldable Screen and Galaxy Book6 Laptops
items.summary: Samsung revealed a creaseless foldable display hinting at future devices like iPhone Fold and new Galaxy Book6 laptops powered by Intel tech aimed at competing with Apple.

items.title: Lenovo Announces ThinkBook Plus Gen 7 Auto Twist Laptop
items.summary: Lenovo introduced the ThinkBook Plus Gen 7 Auto Twist with a motorized display that tracks users during calls using a 10MP webcam, Intel Core Ultra Series 3, up to 32GB RAM, starting at $1,649 in June.

items.title: Samsung Outlines Bespoke AI 2026 Home Appliances Vision
items.summary: Samsung detailed its Bespoke AI appliances as 'Home Companions' connected via SmartThings, using Bixby, screens, and cameras for proactive user adaptation across appliances, TVs, and mobiles.

items.title: Hisense, TCL, and Philips Confirm Dolby Vision 2 Support in 2026 TVs
items.summary: The first TV brands supporting Dolby Vision 2, the next HDR format evolution, are Hisense, TCL, and Philips, announced at CES 2026 for upcoming models.

items.title: Boston Dynamics Plans Atlas Humanoid Robot for Workforce in 2028
items.summary: Boston Dynamics announced its Atlas humanoid robot will enter the workforce in 2028 following years of stress-test demonstrations.
